column1: Archived - Number of full-time and part-time educators, public elementary and secondary schools, by age group and sex, inactive 1 2 3 4 5

column2: All counts are randomly rounded to a multiple of 3 using the following procedure: counts that are already a multiple of 3 are not adjusted; counts 1 greater than a multiple of 3 are adjusted to the next lowest multiple of 3 with a probability of two-thirds and to the next highest multiple of 3 with a probability of one-third. The probabilities are reversed for counts that are 1 less than a multiple of 3.
The data are subject to revision.
Includes all employees who belong to one of the three following categories: teachers, school administrators, and pedagogical support personnel.
Care should be taken with cross-jurisdictional comparisons. The proportion of educators (comprising a mix of teachers, administrators and pedagogical support) differs in each jurisdiction.
Figures may not add up to the sum of all categories due to missing categories and/or rounding values.
Ontario began including early childhood educators in 2010/2011; therefore, data for 2010/2011 and subsequent years are not strictly comparable with data for the years before 2010/2011.
In Manitoba, data prior to 2011/2012 are not comparable with more recent data due to a change in methodology.
All educators in Lloydminster are included in Saskatchewan's counts and not in the counts for Alberta.
In Alberta, data prior to 2004/2005 are not comparable with more recent data due to a change in methodology.
In British Columbia, data prior to 2012/2013 are not comparable with more recent data due to a change in data source and reporting approach.
In Yukon, data prior to 2012/2013 are not comparable with more recent data due to a change in methodology.

column1: How to cite: Statistics Canada. Table 37-10-0010-01  Number of full-time and part-time educators, public elementary and secondary schools, by age group and sex, inactive
